content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-265-02-B
|Item_parent=Urinary lithiasis
|Item_parent_short=Urinary lithiasis
|Rank=B
|Title=Epidemiology of urinary lithiasis
|Description=Epidemiology and distribution of stones
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Romain Boissier
|Order=2}}

The incidence of urinary lithiasis varies from country to country, depending on geographical, climatic, ethnic, dietary and genetic factors. The prevalence of urolithiasis varies from 1% to 20% worldwide. In France, the prevalence is estimated at almost 10%.

The sex ratio is 2 men to 1 woman.

question.title: What is the estimated prevalence of urinary lithiasis in France?
question.description: The prevalence of urinary lithiasis varies from country to country, depending on geographical, climatic, ethnic, dietary and genetic factors.

option_a.description: A relatively low prevalence of urinary lithiasis in France

option_b.description: A moderate prevalence of urinary lithiasis in France, consistent with the global average

option_c.description: A high prevalence of urinary lithiasis in France, possibly due to specific dietary habits

option_d.description: A very high prevalence of urinary lithiasis in France, likely due to genetic factors

correct_option.title: Correct Option
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
